    • Uses of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval

      Subinterfaces of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataTrainable
      A base class for Trainable objects advertizing an API for setting and accessing the training data.
      interface  SampledTrainable
      A trainable contract for variable sample size; smaller values result in faster but less representative evaluations.
      interface  Trainable
      Base class for an object which can be evaluated using differential weights.
      interface  TrainableDataMask
      A Trainable supplemental contract exposing a boolean mask which configures which, if any, input columns are to be adjusted by the learning procedure.
      Classes in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.eval that implement ReferenceCounting 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ArrayTrainable
      Basic training component which evaluates a static array of data on a network.
      class  BasicTrainable
      This class handles dispatching network evaluations, and distributing the evaluations to the system GPU(s).
      class  BatchedTrainable
      Base class to manage batched execution, where a data setByCoord is executed in segments in order to manage execution memory requirements.
      class  CachedTrainable<T extends Trainable>
      A wrapper which maintains a hisotry of N prior evaluations.
      class  ConstL12Normalizer
      This Trainable wrapper adds additional L1 and L2 terms for weight normalization.
      class  L12Normalizer
      Abstract base class for a trainable wrapper that adds per-key L1 and L2 normalization constants.
      class  SampledArrayTrainable
      This type handles the data selection part of stochastic gradient descent training.
      class  SampledCachedTrainable<T extends SampledTrainable>
      A type-merging class for Trainable objects which are both Sampled and Cached.
      class  TensorListTrainable
      This class handles dispatching network evaluations, and distributing the evaluations to the system GPU(s).
      class  TrainableBase
      Base class for an object which can be evaluated using differential weights.
      class  TrainableWrapper<T extends Trainable>
      A base class for a Trainable type which wraps an heapCopy type of the same kind.

      A special type of Result which ignores backpropigation; it has a constant value.

      An arithmetic evalInputDelta being staged to effect an in-memory change to a double[] array.

      This is a collection of Deltas being staged for particular layers.
      class  DoubleBuffer<K>
      A generic alternate memory buffer being staged in relation to an existing double[] array.

      A collection of DoubleBuffer objects being staged for particular layers.

      class  LayerBase

      class  PointSample
      Represents an evaluation record used during optimization of a function apply one scalar output and many inputs.

      class  RegisteredObjectBase

      class  ReshapedTensorList
      A wrapper TensorList data to override the existing tensor key.
      class  Result
      Encapsulates the results of evaluating neural network.
      class  State<K>
      Alternate version being staged to effect an in-memory change to a double[] array.
      class  StateSet<K>
      A collection of State objects being staged for particular layers.
      class  Tensor
      A multi-dimensional array of data.
      class  TensorArray
      An on-heap implementation of the TensorList data container.

    • Uses of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers

      Subinterfaces of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  StochasticComponent
      A parent interface for layers which should be "shuffled" often, generally when the key has some random noise-determining state.
      Classes in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.layers that implement ReferenceCounting 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LoggingWrapperLayer
      This wrapper adds a highly verbose amount of logging to System.out detailing all inputs and outputs during forward and backwards evaluation.
      class  MonitoringWrapperLayer
      A diagnostic wrapper that collects performance data and, if enabled, value statistics of output and backprop signals.
      class  PlaceholderLayer<T>
      An ephemeral, non-serializable, non-evaluatable key.
      class  ValueLayer
      This key does not require any input, and produces a constant output.
      class  WrapperLayer
      A base class for layers whose actual behavior is delegated.

      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  LineSearchCursor
      A mutable cursor which represents a 1-d optimization problem.
      Classes in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.line that implement ReferenceCounting 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FailsafeLineSearchCursor
      A wrapper for a line search cursor which tracks the best-known point.
      class  LineSearchCursorBase
      A mutable cursor which represents a 1-d optimization problem.
      class  LineSearchPoint
      A particular point in a LayerBase line search phase.
      class  SimpleLineSearchCursor
      A basic line search cursor representing a linear parametric path.

    • Uses of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient

      Subinterfaces of ReferenceCounting in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  OrientationStrategy<T extends LineSearchCursor>
      Base class for the "orientation" optimization sub-component.
      Classes in com.simiacryptus.mindseye.opt.orient that implement ReferenceCounting 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DescribeOrientationWrapper
      This wrapper adds extra logging to the orientation step.
      class  GradientDescent
      The most basic type of orientation, which uses the raw function gradient.
      class  LBFGS
      An implementation of the Limited-Memory Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno algorithm https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited-memory_BFGS
      class  MomentumStrategy
      A simple momentum module which uses a cumulative decay algorithm to add a momentum term to any orientation strategy (if it yields a SimpleLineSearch cursor)
      class  OrientationStrategyBase<T extends LineSearchCursor>
      The type Orientation strategy base.
      class  OwlQn
      Orthant-Wise Limited-memory Quasi-Newton optimization This is a modified L-BFGS algorithm which uses orthant trust regions to bound the cursor path during the line search phase of each iteration
      class  QuantifyOrientationWrapper
      An orientation wrapper which adds additional log statements.
      class  ValidatingOrientationWrapper
      This strategy uses finite-difference methods to estimate a numerical derivative, and compares it apply the derivative supplied by the heapCopy's cursor.
